item.title: Ukraine Seeks Decadeslong Security Guarantee as Trump Offers 15 Years
item.description: Kyiv said the guarantee offered by the U.S. would be too short to deter Russia from future aggression.
item.dc:creator: Anastasiia Malenko

item.title: Chinese Military Drills Send ‘Stern Warning’ After U.S. Arms Sales to Taiwan
item.description: The major military exercises come as tensions grow with the U.S. and Japan over the security of the island.
item.dc:creator: Joyu Wang

item.title: See How a Chinese Attack on Taiwan Would Be Japan’s Problem
item.description: In a conflict, Taipei’s fate would become quickly intertwined with the U.S.-Japan security alliance.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Kiss

item.title: A Pottery Studio Has Become Ukrainians’ Great Escape
item.description: Sculptor’s classes are a big draw for locals seeking a distraction from daily shellings.
item.dc:creator: Angus Loten

item.title: Families, Neighbors Informed on Each Other in Assad’s Syria, With Deadly Consequences
item.description: Intelligence files found in a Damascus prison complex reveal cases that led to brutal detentions; a wife records a husband.
item.dc:creator: Jared Malsin

item.title: Trump Says Talks to End Ukraine War Yield Progress Though Hurdles Remain
item.description: The U.S. president offers few specifics after a phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin and a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.
item.dc:creator: Alex Leary

item.title: Opinion | Smartphones and the Childhood Epidemic of Myopia
item.description: Time indoors looking at screens can cause eyeballs to elongate, leaving kids nearsighted for life.

item.title: ‘A Call at 4 a.m.’ Review: Knesset Chronicles
item.description: A history of modern Israeli politics tells the story of leaders who won’t exit the stage and parties that split and split again.
item.dc:creator: Elliot Kaufman

item.title: Opinion | Venezuela and Cuba: What’s Next?
item.description: The U.S. and its Latin American allies need a plan for the day after the dictators fall.
item.dc:creator: Mary Anastasia O’Grady

item.title: Thailand, Cambodia Agree to Immediate Cease-Fire in Border Clashes
item.description: At least 22 civilians—21 in Cambodia and one in Thailand—have been killed since an earlier truce collapsed on Dec. 8.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: As Memories of Fukushima Fade, Japan Seeks Bigger Role for Nuclear Power
item.description: The reboot of reactor on the Sea of Japan coast will mark a milestone for a nation that suffered one of the world’s worst nuclear disasters.
item.dc:creator: Junko Fukutome

item.title: Trump, Zelensky to Meet on Bridging Gaps in Draft Peace Deal
item.description: The high-level talks come after a flurry of U.S.-Ukraine negotiations, but Russia remains a possible obstacle.
item.dc:creator: Anastasiia Malenko

item.title: Myanmar Junta Seeks Legitimacy in Widely Condemned Elections Embraced by U.S.
item.description: The Trump administration has joined a small number of countries—including China and Russia—in backing the vote, which is being held amid a brutal civil war.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: Three Months, 19,687 Nautical Miles: This Lengthy Trade Route Is Peak Globalization
item.description: A Chinese ship sails the long way around the world to deliver cranes to the U.S. Gulf Coast and Jamaica.
item.dc:creator: Paul Berger

item.title: Trump’s Broadside at Europe Also Swipes at a U.S. Legacy
item.description: The president’s antipathy to the bloc represents the most fundamental reassessment of U.S. trans-Atlantic policy since the Cold War.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Michaels

item.title: Trump Wants a Weaker Dollar. Some Chinese Say He Has a Point.
item.description: A significant weakening of the dollar versus China’s currency didn’t happen in 2025, but some forecasters say it’s a wild card to watch in the new year.
item.dc:creator: Peter Landers

item.title: Ukraine’s Source of Pride—a Sprawling Rail Network—Has Become a Key Target
item.description: More than 1,100 Russian attacks this year have targeted everything from control towers and bridges to trains and the substations that power them.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Opinion | Ukraine’s New Concessions for Peace
item.description: Kyiv may cede territory in exchange for U.S. security guarantees.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Where Drones Drop Dead and GPS Goes Haywire
item.description: As the risk of conflict grows in the Arctic, Western militaries and startups are working to tackle the unique challenges of fighting there.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: Argentina’s Milei Wins Budget Vote, Marking a Shift Toward Dealmaking
item.description: Argentina’s Congress passes its first budget since President Javier Milei took office two years ago and largely sidestepped lawmakers to push through a free-market overhaul.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: Europe Tried to Slam the Door on Russian Energy. It Didn’t Account for Turkey.
item.description: The EU is increasing scrutiny of Turkey’s oil-storage facilities and considering sanctions on entire ports.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Dalton

item.title: Iran Eases Social Rules Amid Crises—but Crushes Dissent
item.description: Facing sanctions pressure and still reeling from war with Israel, Iran’s regime is tolerating women shunning hijabs, even as it cracks down on political dissent.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: A Tiny Pacific Paradise Is Gaming the U.S.-China Rivalry Over Minerals
item.description: The Cook Islands—population 15,000—are being courted by the two superpowers as they hunt for more rare earths, and could stand to reap a windfall.
item.dc:creator: Yusuf Khan

item.title: The Unexpected Winner of Rising American Tariffs Is Mexico
item.description: Its exports to the U.S. have surged since President Trump imposed new import duties on countries this year.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Harrup

item.title: Opinion | Trump Bombs ISIS in Africa
item.description: He cites attacks on Christians, as jihad spreads in Nigeria and across the Sahel.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: U.S. Strikes on Nigeria Targeted Islamic State Camps With Missile Barrage
item.description: The U.S. military said multiple militants had been killed in an attack that again showed President Trump’s focus on deterring violence against Christians.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Opinion | The EU Tells Native Americans How to Manage Our Forests
item.description: It acts like a colonizer in dictating standards for ‘deforestation free’ imported goods.
item.dc:creator: Carla Keene

item.title: Opinion | Churchill’s Berlin Confusion
item.description: The prime minister thought he was dining with a different I. Berlin.

item.title: Saudi Arabia Strikes Yemeni Militia Backed by Rival Gulf Power U.A.E.
item.description: Tensions between two U.S. allies heat up amid proxy conflicts in the region.
item.dc:creator: Saleh al-Batati

item.title: Meet the BofA Investment Banker Vying to Represent Haiti in the Winter Paralympics
item.description: Ralf Etienne juggles long workdays and intense training in the Alps that was delayed by changes in U.S. immigration policy.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Saeedy

item.title: Is ‘The West’ Over?
item.description: As Europe-U.S. relations become more strained, once-unshakeable allies abroad wonder whether the rift can be repaired.
item.dc:creator: Marcus Walker

item.title: China Sanctions Boeing, Other U.S. Companies Over Taiwan Arms Sale
item.description: Beijing responded to the Trump administration’s approval of a large weapons package for Taipei with restrictions on firms and executives.
item.dc:creator: Stu Woo

item.title: Trump’s Inner Circle Sees Russia as an El Dorado for Business, but Pitfalls Abound
item.description: Veteran U.S. investors say Vladimir Putin’s Russia will remain a treacherous business environment.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: U.S. Launched Christmas Day Strike Against ISIS in Nigeria
item.description: The president previously said he would move to protect the country’s Christian population.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: Coast Guard Tracks Down Runaway Oil Tanker Linked to Iran and Venezuela
item.description: The U.S. is gathering more manpower and weaponry to seize the sanctioned Bella 1 as it flees in the Atlantic.
item.dc:creator: Shelby Holliday

item.title: This Dynasty of Watchmakers Outlived an Empire. Can It Survive the Modern World?
item.description: One family’s centurieslong trade provides a window on British colonial history and Kenya’s independence, but its time looks to be coming to a close.
item.dc:creator: Michael M. Phillips

item.title: Israelis Divided Over How to Investigate Failures Leading to Oct. 7
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is proposing he oversee a commission to determine the scope of an inquiry.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: India Is on a Himalayan Building Spree to Prepare for a Clash With China
item.description: A deadly standoff jolted India to stitch together a huge network of roads, tunnels and landing strips needed to move soldiers and supplies to the mountainous border region.
item.dc:creator: Ming Li

item.title: How an Elusive Banker Allegedly Kept North Korea’s Dirty Money Flowing
item.description: The FBI is offering $7 million to catch Sim Hyon Sop, whose role according to U.S. officials is vital to Kim Jong Un’s regime.
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: China Developing Options to Threaten Taiwan With ‘Brute Force,’ Pentagon Says
item.description: An annual assessment of Beijing’s military strength concludes China can increasingly threaten U.S. territory.
item.dc:creator: Marcus Weisgerber

item.title: Six Months After War, Israel Warns It Could Strike Iran Again
item.description: Israeli officials say Tehran’s efforts to rebuild its ballistic-missile program could trigger new military action, complicating U.S. efforts to stabilize the region.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: Trump-Backed Candidate Wins Honduran Presidential Election
item.description: Nasry “Tito” Asfura, who got a boost after the U.S. president’s endorsement, is declared winner of a tight and chaotic election.
item.dc:creator: Juan Carlos Rivera

item.title: U.S. Delays New Tariffs on Chinese Chips Until 2027
item.description: The Trump administration accused China of employing unfair trade practices in the semiconductor industry but said it would hold off on imposing additional tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Sabrina Siddiqui

item.title: Zelensky Proposes Demilitarized Zone in Eastern Ukraine as Way to Peace
item.description: The Ukrainian president said he would be willing to pull troops from Donetsk provided Russia did the same.
item.dc:creator: Anastasiia Malenko

item.title: The U.S. Offered Putin’s Closest Ally Sanctions Relief—and a Weight-Loss Drug
item.description: Engaging one of the world’s most repressive regimes, Trump envoy bonded with Belarusian dictator over Zepbound and obtained the release of hundreds of prisoners.
item.dc:creator: Meridith McGraw

item.title: Senior Libyan Military Leaders Die in Plane Crash
item.description: An army chief and commander of ground forces for the government in Tripoli were among five confirmed killed shortly after takeoff in Turkey.
item.dc:creator: Elvan Kivilcim

item.title: Captive Scam Workers in Cambodia Couldn’t Flee as Bombs Fell
item.description: Laborers being held against their will to run online scams were forced to keep working even as Thai military attacks on a disputed border area intensified.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: U.S. Targeting Oil Tankers in Bid to Stymie Global Black Market
item.description: Trump administration is aiming to interrupt a shadow fleet of tankers that supply sanctioned oil to several U.S. adversaries.
item.dc:creator: Costas Paris

item.title: China’s Sprint for Tech Dominance Can’t Hide an Economy Full of Holes
item.description: A self-sufficiency push has made China a tougher competitor to the U.S., but it comes with enormous waste.
item.dc:creator: Brian Spegele

item.title: A Russian Billionaire Fights Global Infertility—With 100 of His Own Children
item.description: Telegram founder Pavel Durov will cover IVF costs for women who want to use his donated sperm, and has promised his offspring a share of his fortune.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Venezuela Is Relying on 20 Aging Planes After U.S. Restricted Its Airspace
item.description: The campaign to topple President Nicolás Maduro is stranding Venezuelans around the world, compounding the misery of a beleaguered population.
item.dc:creator: Kejal Vyas

item.title: Jurors Deadlock in Trial of Linda Sun, Accused of Acting as China Agent
item.description: A mistrial was declared on charges against the former New York state aide and her husband.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: Russian General Killed by Car Bomb in Moscow
item.description: Moscow said Ukraine might be responsible for the killing of the head of the General Staff’s army operational training directorate.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Bondi Beach Terror Suspects Condemned ‘Zionists’ and Amassed an Arsenal
item.description: Court documents reveal what police say were the movements and motivation of Sajid and Naveed Akram.
item.dc:creator: Jon Emont

item.title: Returning Russian POWs Pay Heavy Price for Choosing Surrender Over Death
item.description: The joy of homecoming is short-lived for returning prisoners, as they face insults, cut pay and orders to return to the front line.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: U.K. Government Borrowing Fell, But Challenges Ahead
item.description: The narrower November deficit was largely due to an increase in revenues following the government’s decision to increase a tax on employment.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Bondi Beach Shooting Suspect Charged With Terrorism, Murder
item.description: Police charged 24-year-old Naveed Akram after he woke up from a coma.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: U.K. Inflation Slows to Eight-Month Low as BOE Prepares Rate Decision
item.description: Prices cooled more than expected in November, keeping the Bank of England on course for a fourth interest-rate cut of the year.
item.dc:creator: Ed Frankl

item.title: Bondi Beach Attack Badly Shakes Sense of Safety for Australia’s Jews
item.description: There has been frustration among Sydney’s Jewish community that authorities haven’t heeded warnings about a rise in antisemitism.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Father and Son Used Licensed Firearms in Sydney Terror Attack, Police Say
item.description: The Australian prime minister said the suspects acted alone, as he called for tighter gun controls after the deadly Hanukkah shooting.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Miao

item.title: Terrorist Attack Targets Jews at Sydney’s Bondi Beach, Killing 15
item.description: The suspects are a father, also killed, and his son, in the shooting at a Hanukkah event.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Charles III Gives ‘Good News’ on Cancer Treatment
item.description: The British monarch, who was diagnosed last year, said his treatment is due to be scaled back in 2026.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: U.K. Economy Contracts Again, Likely Cementing BOE Rate Cut
item.description: Economic activity dipped 0.1% on month in October. Economists polled by The Wall Street Journal had expected an increase.
item.dc:creator: Don Nico Forbes

item.title: Britain Asked a Power Plant to Build a ‘Fish Disco.’ It’s Not Going Well.
item.description: Plans to use a deep-sea boom box to keep fish away from a coastal nuclear station have gone awry. DJing for marine life, it turns out, is a nightmare.
item.dc:creator: Eliot Brown

item.title: ‘India’ and ‘Let My Country Awake’ Review: History at an Audacious Scale
item.description: Audrey Truschke’s single-volume work makes a bold attempt to capture thousands of years of cultural ferment on the Indian subcontinent.

item.title: Russia and India’s Complicated Relationship Hinges on Oil
item.description: The two countries’ reliance on each other in the energy sector is coming under strain.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Putin and Modi Deepen Relationship That Has Drawn Trump’s Anger
item.description: The Russian president is embarking on a high-profile visit to India, aiming to protect a partnership that is a crucial for Moscow.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Pakistan Points Finger at India Over Suicide Blast
item.description: The accusation came as India’s prime minister vowed to find the perpetrators of a separate deadly explosion on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy
